title: Drawing, "Perspective Design for a Painted Dome and Cupola of a Church", 1700–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on off-white laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: View looking up into a circular coffered cupola, sculpted with flowers. An entablature consisting of three windows separated by pillars supports the interior ceiling.  A lantern tops the cupola.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Perspective Design for a Painted Dome and Cupola of a Church", 1700–25.
1700–25. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3461.
